attributes.action: Allow smoke bombs/pyrotechnics at football matches.
attributes.background: It will improve the atmosphere at the games.

attributes.action: British Overseas Territories must be allowed to negotiate with the EU directly
attributes.background: British Overseas Territories benefit from a special relationship with the European Union allowing freedom of movement, international investment and direct EU financial input. There was no opportunity for Territories to vote in the referendum and the decision by the UK will impact them.
attributes.additional_details: British Overseas Territories benefit from a special relationship with the European Union allowing freedom of movement, international investment and direct EU financial input. Following the UK vote to leave the EU, all Overseas Territories, who had no opportunity to vote, require the ability to negotiate with the EU without restriction from the UK.

attributes.action: Future referendums to be subject to a 40% of eligible voters threshold.
attributes.background: A petition to require that all future referendums which would trigger constitutional change should be subject to both an absolute majority of those voting AND a 40% of eligible voters threshold.

attributes.action: A 30 hour working week, also make any extra hours worked payable in overtime.
attributes.background: I work in hospitality, and have realised that the people working in hotels are overworked and very underpaid. But not only in this industry, lorry drivers, security guards shopworkers, every industry.

attributes.action: Block the ability to share government petitions on Facebook.
attributes.background: We are seeing an increase in the number of petitions created and shared on social media. These petitions have become slightly annoying and we this British people urge for these to be distributed by private messaging only.

attributes.action: Debate security implications of the removal of U.K. border controls from Calais.
attributes.background: Politicians in France are calling on President Hollande to scrap immigration checks on the French side of the English Channel following UK's vote to leave the EU. We need to know what this means for the UK.

attributes.action: Make Government & Politics an optional GCSE subject
attributes.background: Government & Politics is currently not an existing GCSE qualification, with increased voter apathy in particular amongst young people, giving them the tools to engage in the political process, should they wish, from an earlier age than currently exists may increase political participation.
attributes.additional_details: In the EU Referendum (2016) voter turnout amongst 18-24 year olds was 36% (@SkyData), however the turnout for the referendum as a whole was 72% showing voter apathy to be particular prevalent amongst the young.

attributes.action: Trigger Article 50 and then immediately hold a general Election
attributes.background: Votes have been cast, now we demand the government deliver change. No politicians have a mandate to take this forward.

attributes.action: Increase funding to engage those 18-24 in the voting process
attributes.background: Turnout has fallen from over 60% in the early 1990s to an average of 40% and is estimated around 36% for Brexit. More funding is needed for neutral education on the system and process.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the British Election Study, the proportion of registered 18 to 24-year-olds turning out to vote has consistently been below every other age group since the 1970s.

Eurobarometer suggested that young British adults are among the least engaged with the political process when comparing their peers across Europe.

Young people do not only vote less, but research by the Electoral Commission suggests they are less likely to be on the electoral register than other age groups.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell cot bumper which can cause suffocation to babies.
attributes.background: The safety of cot bumpers is questionable because of the risk of suffocation and/or strangulation. They can also be used to climb on when your baby becomes more mobile so they're not recommended yet they still sold in stores to unaware parents.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2015/11/151124081508.htm

attributes.action: Not allow people over 60 to vote in referendums or other elections.
attributes.background: Many elections including the EU referendum will mainly affect people who are currently working. Only people between 18-60 should be able to vote as the outcome is going to only affect them especially people aged 18-30 as it is there future which could be at stake.
attributes.additional_details: In the recent EU referendum, according to YouGov, 75% of people aged 18-25 voted to remain apart of the EU. It's their future which is going to affected by older people who may not still be around for the outcome of the referendum.

attributes.action: Scotland should hold a second independence referendum within 6 months.
attributes.background: The Scottish people should be given an opportunity to choose between remaining in the EU or the United Kingdom. From England's perspective this issue needs resolving quickly so that negotiations with the EU can proceed without uncertainty over Scotland's position.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's on road,6pm Friday to 6am Monday,June to August,for holiday traffic.
attributes.background: This proposal would considerably ease congestion in the holiday season,and has been shown to work in Sweden.Goods deliveries can be scheduled during the rest of the week with minimal disruption .

attributes.action: Start petition to have Scotland removed from the UK
attributes.background: Nicola Sturgeon has undemocratically gone against EU referendum .The SNP are threatening to veto Exit of UK from EU.As this is against the wish o the majority it is undemocratic and an outrage against the majority! Scotland itself did not get in entirety for remaining.
attributes.additional_details: The lack of acceptance to exit is dangerous and selfish.The selfishness of the Scottish Parliament is a threat to a proud and strong UK.

attributes.action: Rename the 'House of Lords' to give it a gender neutral title.
attributes.background: The House of Lords immortalises the idea that it is men who rule the country. In order to take a significant step towards an otherwise overlooked deficiency in political equality, we should retitle the House of Lords so as to retain gender neutrality - for instance, to the House of Peers.

attributes.action: let Australian and other Commonwealth countries practice Nursing in the UK
attributes.background: Let countries such as Australia be able to come to the UK and practice Nursing unlike the current law of only letting EU nurses practice with out having to re-training

attributes.action: Block all suspected and convicted terrorists and murderers from entering the UK
attributes.background: Block all suspected and convicted terrorists and murderers from entering the UK, regardless of nationality.

attributes.action: Independence For The South West Of England Creating The Kingdom Of Wessex.
attributes.background: I am sick of politicians In London letting the South West Rot, Not providing enough money for better education, updating infrastructure and stimulating enough jobs or housing for the people like me who was born in the South West and will die in the South West. Now it is time for Independence.
attributes.additional_details: 1) We need updated High speed rail Infrastructure but the government won't spend a penny because we are not worth it despite Devon alone creating over £1Billion in Tourist revenue each year. We need fast and effective rail networks to keep this growing, not clapped out rickety junk. 2) Have a look around the South West town or city you live in and you can tell there is a massive lack of funding for everything. Not enough police on the streets, or enough to even investigate crime any crime.

attributes.action: Ensure sovereignty cannot be transferred from parliament without a referendum.
attributes.background: When we leave the EU the power to make and enforce laws will be returned to the UK parliament and courts.  We need legislation to ensure that in future no government can transfer any aspect of sovereignty away from the UK parliament and courts without a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The power of the UK parliament and courts to make and enforce legislation has been gradually eroded over 40 years of EU membership.  Now that we are at last getting these powers back we need legislation affirming that sovereignty, that is to say the power to make and enforce our own laws, belongs to the people and to ensure that in future no government can transfer any aspect of sovereignty away from the UK parliament and courts without the consent of the people through a referendum.

attributes.action: Offer all pro-EU British citizens a grant to relocate to Europe.
attributes.background: Any current British citizen not wanting to live under UK governance should be offered a grant to relocate to an EU country. By doing so they forfeit forever all privileges afforded by the UK - such as free health care, pensions, disability benefits, social housing etc.

attributes.action: Cut down University fees to £6,000
attributes.background: Kids/teenagers in this generation want to do well for the future and to do that they need to go University. But how will they go University if the University fee's are higher than they used to be? What if the fees go higher?

attributes.action: Make it law that only one referendum can be held on an issue in a 5 year period
attributes.background: Following the result of the EU referendum which took months of campaigning and cost millions of taxpayer's pounds, some people who voted remain are attempting to have a 2nd referendum called because they weren't happy with the majority vote. A referendum should be a one time vote on an issue.
attributes.additional_details: A 2nd EU referendum would cost millions of pounds more of tax payers money and be inflicted on a public who generally don't have the appetite for a 2nd referendum. This would be the case in future referendums on other issues too as a precedent would be set now if a 2nd referendum was called.

attributes.action: Stop all future referendums from July 2016
attributes.background: Referendums cause division, animosity and pull the country apart.

attributes.action: to create a house of lords with 100 ELECTED members
attributes.background: austerity should of started with the amount we waste on the nearly 900 peers in the house of lords. america has 535 politicians in both houses it is time to reduce our politicians.

attributes.action: EU referendum voting
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule that if the remain or leave vote is more than 50.1% based and a turnout of more than  55% there should not be another referendum.

attributes.action: support china's claim over the south china sea
attributes.background: China's claim over the south china sea has historic routes and china has pushed for countries to recognize its rightful claim to the south china sea. Thus far however the UK has refused to do so. The UK should recognize China's claim over it to both strengthen ties and recognize a historical claim.

attributes.action: Hold an early General Election when Brexit terms have been agreed.
attributes.background: Now that Britain has decided to leave, but on terms not yet agreed, it is only right that whatever the terms end up being that they are put to the people at a General Election to get a proper mandate.

attributes.action: Make anyone over the age of 50 unable to vote in a Second EU Election
attributes.background:
Recently the Elderly Population of this Country has been able to Dictate over the Young Generation of this great nation.
Lets make sure that the People that are going to be affected by Brexit and other elections the most decide.
Also to make the system equal, by lowering the minimum age to 15.

attributes.action: Block retrospective changes to the European Referendum Act 2015
attributes.background: The referendum to leave the European Union was carried out fairly and in line with the following act; European Union Referendum Act 2015. We the undersigned petition that this act is not ammended retrospectively and no provisions made for a minimum turnout to be achieved for results to be binding.

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum in England and Wales only
attributes.background: Scotland have voted to be part of the UK and part of EU. England and Wales have voted to leave the EU. The second referendum question should be in England and Wales only and should ask
attributes.additional_details: "Should England and Wales continue to be part of a United Kingdom that is part of the EU or be in independent country outside the EU?"

attributes.action: UK to hold a new EU referendum if Scotland leave the UK before Brexit.
attributes.background: If Scotland vote leave the UK before the EU exit the UK public should have a new EU referendum where they can consider these significantly changed circumstances.

attributes.action: EU Independence referendums for British cities and regions
attributes.background: To allow British cities and regions to hold Independence referendums and be able to choose individual EU membership. Allow individual cities and regions to group together to form a united group based on their views.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 16 and stop over 65+ voting
attributes.background: The voting age should be lowered to 16 and over 65+ voting should be stopped

attributes.action: Vote against any act of Parliament related to EU exit in the next 3 months
attributes.background: A referendum is for guidance to our elected representatives - it does not absolve MPs from using their judgement. The will of the people is divided and not settled: the UK majority was only 3.8% and the future of the Union is in jeopardy. As the implications become clearer Public opinion may shift.

attributes.action: Make UK election/referendum process compulsory in the national curriculum.
attributes.background: It is evident from many media reports after the recent EU referendum and following local/general elections, that a significant percentage of UK residents do not fully understand election/referendum processes. It reasonably follows that UK-wide education is required to remedy this.
attributes.additional_details: Too many references to mention in media of all natures including popularly watched/listened to television/radio channels and social media networks.

attributes.action: Mandate gov't to create a non partisan advisory panel for the Brexit process
attributes.background: Mandate the government to create an independent advisory body of experts (across finance, business, politics, academia etc) to support and advise on the Brexit process - to ensure the best result for the British people. Advisory Council to represent all professional spheres.
attributes.additional_details:
On June 23rd 2016, the UK voting populace voted at the EU referendum to leave the European Union - with a simple majority of approx 52%. Following this, the Prime Minister has indicated he will step aside for a Brexit government to lead the country to invoke the leaving process.
A new government will require the support and expertise of a non-political advisory body, to bring the best research and knowledge in achieving the most beneficial Brexit for the British, EU and global populations.

attributes.action: Raise the age to 18 for a child's train ticket
attributes.background: I was on the train going to Lisburn, the conductor asked me what age I was, I replied "16". He then went on to say I cannot give you a child ticket as you are 16 proceeding to give me a lecture on how it is illegal to ask for a child's ticket.Yet you are still considered a 'child' till you are 18.
attributes.additional_details: How do they expect us to get the money to pay for VERY expensive train journeys when we have just left school. We have no income, as individuals need time to get a job or go into further education - this can be very costly depending on what uni/tech you would like to attend.

attributes.action: Allow 14-17 year olds to have their votes on the EU added to the  voting total
attributes.background:
The EU referendum is a vote for over 18 year olds to decide whether to stay or leave

This vote affects the futures of young people, and not the elderly, who are responsible for 60% of leave votes in the 65+ category. This raises the question of: Why shouldn't youths get to decide on their future?
attributes.additional_details:
-73% of 18-24 year olds voted to remain in the EU
-62% of 25-34 year olds voted to remain in the EU
-52% of 35-44 year olds voted to remain in the EU

These facts illustrate what the people who are affected most by the vote wanted. Sadly, they are having their futures decided by the older generations, to whom the vote will not affect.

By signing this petition, you are allowing the younger generation to decide on their own future.

Source: 'BBC News: EU referendum: The result in maps and charts'

attributes.action: Every referendum must include a 'No Confidence in the Government' option
attributes.background: The Brexit vote was 52% leave 48% remain. A very small element of protest voting against the current government could have changed the result.

attributes.action: Reaffirm and support equality and worker's rights in post-EU Britain.
attributes.background:
Following the vote to leave the EU, it is likely that the UK will cease to be bound by EU laws, which underpin vital legal protections for British citizens.

The undersigned call upon MPs to reaffirm those acts such as the Employment Rights Act (1996) and Equality Act (2010).
attributes.additional_details:
The undersigned also ask MPs to reject weakening of principles established in EU laws such as:
The Working Time Regulations, 
The Pregnant Workers Directive, 
The Parental Leave Directive, 
The Information and Consultation of Employees Directive (adopted as the Works Council Directive in UK law), 
The Equality Framework Directive, 
The Race Equality Directive, 
The Equal Treatment Directive, 
The Insolvency Protection Directive

attributes.action: Allow Scotland to hold another referendum.
attributes.background:
Britain is currently backing a Brexit. The live results show Scotland is clearly not in favour of leaving the EU.

Due to Britain's relationship with the EU having changed since Scotland's referendum took place, it is only fair Scotland are allowed another referendum due to circumstantial changes.

attributes.action: Make it law for sun tan lotions to show the Uva star rating on the packaging
attributes.background: The uva star rating provides us with the broad spectrum cover that the sun cream gives us. The EU standard is 3 star but advice is given that we should be looking for a 4 or 5 star. Many brands do not publish what their rating is so the consumer can not make an informed decision when buying.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bad.org.uk/for-the-public/skin-cancer/sunscreen-fact-sheet

attributes.action: Ban ice cream vans
attributes.background:
Ice cream vans are a nuisance to many people with their noise day after day, especially to housebound and those bringing up children who bear an additional burden of being pestered.

They are the least regulated of any trade in Britain, allowed door to door.

Putting up with them must end.
attributes.additional_details:
"Noise from ice-cream vans can be unwanted and intrusive." South Northamptonshire Council

"Noise from ice-cream vans is unwanted, intrusive and pollutes the environment in which we live in." Neighbours from Hell in Britain 

"aggressive selling.. should be banned" Noise Abatement Society

In 2014 in New York City alone: 1,804 complaints specifically about ice cream van music.

attributes.action: True democracy, Call a referendum if you get 100,000 signatures.
attributes.background: Call a referendum if you get 100,000 signatures. Regardless what it's for. bringing the power back to the people. Let the people decide the future of the UK not politicians or local government we have the power to change and do what is right for the future of the UK

attributes.action: A new ONS prevalence survey into Children's and Young People's Mental Health.
attributes.background: Office of National Statistics prevalence surveys were carried out into Children and Young People's Mental Health in 1999 & 2004.  We have no equivalent up to date information.  There are indicators of a growing problem in the UK in this area.  A new survey would highlight the need for action.
attributes.additional_details:
House of Commons Health Committee, "Children's and Adolescent's mental health and CAMHS: Third Report of Session 2014-15", p17, http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201415/cmselect/cmhealth/342/342.pdf
Chief Medical Officer, "Annual Report 2012: Our Children Deserve Better", ch10 p3, https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/255237/2901304_CMO_complete_low_res_accessible.pdf

attributes.action:
Review how the fines system works.
Using a percentage of total income.
attributes.background:
It would be a much fairer system if the system had a set percentage of total income for any fines handed out, as such the detterant isnt the same to a someone with a high income as it may be to someone on a lower income.
It also lessens the penalty if it is having no effect on the offender.
attributes.additional_details:
I feel this is pretty self explanatory, please review how the fines system is worked, it is an unfair system that currently penalises only people with smaller incomes.

Whilst not acting as a deterrent at all to high income earners.

If the system was worked off a percentage of total income then it would be much fairer to all, no matter how much money they have.
The percentage could increase the worse the crime, this may be a larger deterrent to all offenders.

attributes.action: Increase CSA amount for paying parents on benefits.
attributes.background: At this present moment in time the flat rate for parent paying CSA towards their children is a flat rate of £7 per week regardless of how many children you have. Rightly a packet of nappies cost much higher then this. Benefit parents shouldn't get away with the responsibility of paying petty money.

attributes.action: Stop birth certificate stating "Father Unknown" when the father doesn't register
attributes.background: When registering a babies birth, if the father is not in attendance, either by being unwilling or unable, the father is shown on the certificate as Unknown. I find this unacceptable as it suggests the mother is promiscuous. Please remove the word Unkown and leave blank or allow Unwilling.

attributes.action: Impose age ratings on music videos using the same system used for films.
attributes.background: Some music videos (such as Rihanna's "Better Have My Money" video) contain themes (i.e. glorified cruelty, drug use and nudity) which are inappropriate for children but have no age restrictions.
attributes.additional_details: Parents can't always stop their children from watching videos like this as it can be shown to them by school friends, and or watched on their phones and iPads. It is not always possible for parents to know, and control, what their children are watching. And these videos can be watched by children as young as primary school age. Please sign this petition and help stop this.

attributes.action: Change the repayment threshold of Plan 1 Student Loans in line with inflation.
attributes.background: In 1998 when the government introduced Plan 1 Student loans, the repayment threshold was £15,000 which represented a significant salary level at the time. Interest is applied to the loans annually to ensure the value of the loan outstanding keeps pace with inflation.
attributes.additional_details: With inflation averaging 2.7% a year, if the repayment threshold had also been increased (in line with the interest added to the outstanding balance) in order to account for the rise in salaries to match the increase in the cost of living, the repayment threshold would now stand at £24,645.
